intro: Chapmanolirion, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground stem, which stores water and nutrients. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, typically blooming in spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are adapted to conserve moisture in arid environments. Chapmanolirion is well-suited to rocky soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant in desert ecosystems.
